pullRequest.body:
Prove that the padic integers,  `ℤ_[p]`,  are totally bounded and compact, and that the padic numbers,  `ℚ_[p]`,  are locally compact. This was requested [on zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/Zp.20is.20compact.3F). 

Co-authored-by: Kevin Buzzard <k.buzzard@imperial.ac.uk>

---

You've now moved the file to the right place in the hierarchy – thanks!

Sadly github isn't quite clever enough to move the existing review comments across to the new file location, so I've marked all my comments on the previous version as "resolved", and I'm going to post them afresh here.

(By the way, if you go to the "Files changed" tab on the github PR page, you can apply multiple reviewer suggestions as a batch in a single commit, so the automatic build test script only gets triggered once.)
Here are some comments on the first half. Will post some on the second half later.

I've posted some more comments. I hope you won't be discouraged that I've "golfed" your proofs a lot: the overall shape of the proof is still exactly as you wrote it. I think this is a really great contribution to mathlib, and it comes at exactly the right time for me (+ for my project student Giulio, who wants to use this in a proof of Mahler's theorem). Keep up the good work!

Sorry, it was me that screwed up: some of my suggestions weren't totally consistent with each other, which is why the file didn't compile when you applied the suggestion. Here's the fixes to get it working again.

You've now moved the file to the right place in the hierarchy – thanks!

Sadly github isn't quite clever enough to move the existing review comments across to the new file location, so I've marked all my comments on the previous version as "resolved", and I'm going to post them afresh here.

(By the way, if you go to the "Files changed" tab on the github PR page, you can apply multiple reviewer suggestions as a batch in a single commit, so the automatic build test script only gets triggered once.)

You should put the new file somewhere inside the mathlib hierarchy. I suggest `Mathlib/NumberTheory/Padics/LocallyCompact.lean`. Then run `lake exe mk_all` to update the root-level index file `Mathlib.lean` (and make sure you include the changes to Mathlib.lean in your git commit). (If you think this really ought to be done automatically, then yes, I agree.)
I put it in `Mathlib/NumberTheory/Padics/ProperSpace.lean`, to incorporate your recommendation as well as Yury's below

```suggestion
# Local compactness of the p-adic numbers
```

```suggestion
In this file, we prove that `ℤ_[p]` is totally bounded and compact,
```
(Compactness is stronger than total boundedness anyway, so you could omit it: just say "is compact, and that...")

Here's a golfed version:
```suggestion
/-- The set of p-adic integers `ℤ_[p]` is totally bounded. -/
theorem totallyBounded_univ : TotallyBounded (univ : Set ℤ_[p]) := by
  refine Metric.totallyBounded_iff.mpr (fun ε hε ↦ ?_)
  obtain ⟨k, hk⟩ := exists_pow_neg_lt p hε
  refine ⟨Nat.cast '' Finset.range (p ^ k), Set.toFinite _, fun z _ ↦ ?_⟩
  simp only [PadicInt, Set.mem_iUnion, Metric.mem_ball, exists_prop, Set.exists_mem_image]
  refine ⟨z.appr k, ?_, ?_⟩
  · simpa only [Finset.mem_coe, Finset.mem_range] using z.appr_lt k
  · exact (((z - z.appr k).norm_le_pow_iff_mem_span_pow k).mpr (z.appr_spec k)).trans_lt hk
```
This is really just a superficial rearrangement of your proof; the only (tiny) change of actual substance was using the lemma `Set.exists_mem_image` to skip a few steps. I think the last subgoal, `dist z ↑(z.appr k) ≤ ↑p ^ (-↑k)`, may actually be worth factoring out as a lemma in its own right; the existing formulation of `appr_spec` is very algebraic and so not easy to use in analytic / topological contexts like here.

I think you probably want `CompactSpace` (the whole space is compact), not `IsCompact Set.univ`, here. It should also be declared as a typeclass instance (so the typeclass resolution machinery can use it). Perhaps:
```suggestion
/-- The set of p-adic integers `ℤ_[p]` is a compact topological space. -/
instance compactSpace : CompactSpace ℤ_[p] := by
  rw [← isCompact_univ_iff, isCompact_iff_totallyBounded_isComplete]
  exact ⟨totallyBounded p, complete_univ⟩
```

Both of these lemmas are, I think, mostly of interest as stepping stones towards local compactness of Zp; and their proofs can both be golfed so much that I'm not sure it's worth having them as separate lemmas. (E.g. `closed_ball_at_zero` can be proved by `simp [closedBall]`.) So I suggest "in-lining" them, i.e. making them into `have` statements in the main proof later.

I think you're using a sledgehammer to crack a nut here: you're showing that the closed ball is an *open* neighbourhood of 0, which is a distinctive feature of ultrametric spaces. But neighbourhoods don't have to be open -- the definition of a "neighbourhood of `a`" is "any set which contains an open set containing `a`". So it's true in any metric space that the closed ball (of any nonzero radius) around `a` is a neighbourhood of `a` (and mathlib knows this: `closedBall_mem_nhds`).

With this, you can golf the proof to 4 lines:
```suggestion
/-- The field of p-adic numbers `ℚ_[p]` is a locally compact topological space. -/
instance locallyCompact : LocallyCompactSpace ℚ_[p] := by
  have : closedBall 0 1 ∈ 𝓝 (0 : ℚ_[p]) := closedBall_mem_nhds _ zero_lt_one
  simp only [closedBall, dist_eq_norm_sub, sub_zero] at this
  refine IsCompact.locallyCompactSpace_of_mem_nhds_of_addGroup ?_ this
  simpa only [isCompact_iff_compactSpace] using PadicInt.compactSpace p
```
(you'll need an `open Topology` somewhere for the `𝓝` notation.)

Sorry, I got this wrong, it should be 
```suggestion
  exact ⟨totallyBounded_univ p, complete_univ⟩
```

```suggestion
open Metric Topology

```
(and then you can delete `open Metric` at line 53)

```suggestion
```
This is true in any normed group, and we already have [mem_closedBall_zero_iff](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/Normed/Group/Basic.html#mem_closedBall_zero_iff)
Same here.
Please prove `ProperSpace ℚ_[p]` instead.
`Z` should be in blackboard bold
This probably needs an update since the theorems have been renamed since the original draft (& to reflect the change Yury has asked for, properness instead of local compactness)
This can safely be deleted since you are now opening `Metric` higher up the file
These lemmas aren't needed any more and can be deleted

Yury wants you to prove properness, which is a stronger condition than local compactness (and then the typeclass machinery will automatically deduce local compactness from this whenever needed). However, in the current situation the converse implication is also true, so you can do the following:
```suggestion
/-- The field of p-adic numbers `ℚ_[p]` is a proper metric space. -/
instance : ProperSpace ℚ_[p] := by
  suffices LocallyCompactSpace ℚ_[p] from .of_locallyCompactSpace ℚ_[p]
  have : closedBall 0 1 ∈ 𝓝 (0 : ℚ_[p]) := closedBall_mem_nhds _ zero_lt_one
  simp only [closedBall, dist_eq_norm_sub, sub_zero] at this
  refine IsCompact.locallyCompactSpace_of_mem_nhds_of_addGroup ?_ this
  simpa only [isCompact_iff_compactSpace] using PadicInt.compactSpace p
```
(This also requires an extra import, see next comment)

```suggestion
import Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Module.FiniteDimension
import Mathlib.NumberTheory.Padics.RingHoms
```
(see preceding remark)

```suggestion
```
(this line is not needed and can be deleted)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat:  `ℤ_[p]` is totally bounded and compact;  `ℚ_[p]` is locally compact
